race.name: Kyubi
race.description: A cunning and agile people, deeply connected to the sea and the rhythm of the tides, known for their trickery, mysticism, and nomadic lifestyle.

appearance.form: Humanoid foxes with nine distinct tails. Tails covered in fur that varies in color based on environment. They walk upright on two legs, front paws resembling human hands.

racialTraits.trait: Cunning Action: As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.
Fox's Cunning: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks.

Nine-Tails: As a bonus action, you can expend a number of hit dice (up to a maximum equal to your Constitution modifier) to regain hit points. You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this trait again.

tailManeuvers.maneuver: Trip: As a bonus action, you can make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check contested by the target's Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the target is knocked prone.

Distract: As a bonus action, you can create a flurry of distracting movements with your tails, forcing enemies within 5 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or be disadvantaged on their next attack roll.
Balance: While moving, you can use your tails to maintain balance on difficult terrain, granting you advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks to maintain your balance.

roleplayingNotes.note: Playful and Mischievous: Nine-tailed Foxes are known for their playful and mischievous nature.
Independent Spirits: They value their freedom and independence above all else.
Skilled Hunters: They are skilled hunters and survivalists.
Social: Despite their independent nature, Nine-tailed Foxes can form strong bonds within their clans.
